comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: The 30th Battalion’s first major battle was at Fromelles on 19 July 1916. www.awm.gov.au/units/unit_11217.asp The battle is widely regarded as a disaster for the Allies, and has been described as "the worst 24 hours in Australia's entire history." It resulted from a plan to divert German attention from the Battle of the Somme, but historians estimate that 5,500 Australians and 2,000 British troops were killed or wounded. The Australian losses were equivalent to the combined total Australian losses in the Boer War, Korean War and Vietnam War although later World War I actions would be more deadly for the AIF, Fromelles was the only one to achieve no success. (see Wikipedia article Battle of Fromelles)
